data.title: Where We Fly - Rhode Island T. F. Green International Airport
data.meta_description: Explore non-stop destinations from T.F. Green Airport (PVD). Discover travel possibilities with our extensive flight network.
data.meta_site_name: Rhode Island T. F. Green International Airport | PVD
data.text:
ATL

Atlanta

Come see what makes Atlanta one of Lonely Planet’s Best in Travel list for 2022. World-class and unforgettable restaurants, festive and exciting nightlife, professional sports teams, and an abundance of fun attractions and events help make Atlanta the center for entertainment in the South.

BWI

Baltimore

Baltimore was once one of America’s most important port towns, and has changed so much for the better over time. “Charm City” —or “Bawlmer,” as the locals call it—has evolved into one of Maryland’s most popular tourist destinations, with a vibrant nightlife, trendy shops and yummy restaurants, and plenty of museums, art galleries and theater venues for culture lovers. Take a visit to Baltimore!

CHS

Charleston

Charleston is known for its vibrant culture, rich history, exquisitely preserved architecture, beautiful coastal location, scrumptious dining scene and friendly locals. Charleston is one of America’s best loved travel destinations—take a trip today to enjoy all of what Charleston has to offer!

CLT

Charlotte

Charlotte, North Carolina, is exploding with growing businesses, popular sports franchises and an evolving culinary scene. Though the Queen City is known for the Charlotte Motor Speedway and the NASCAR Hall of Fame, it’s much more than a haven for those with a need for speed. Uptown Charlotte is an amazing place to grab a bite to eat and explore shops. Charlotte is a busy and entertaining city that never slows down.

MDW

Chicago Midway

Nestled along the Great Lakes shoreline lies the Windy City. One of the largest cities in the United States with a city population of 2.8 million and a metro population approaching 10 million, Chicago is a huge, vibrant and friendly region that is well known for its live-music scene, comedy, shopping, dining, sports, architecture, highly regarded universities and colleges, and premier cultural attractions such as museums, zoos, aquarium, and planetariums. Take a trip to Chicago today!

ORD

Chicago O’Hare

Nestled along the Great Lakes shoreline lies the Windy City. One of the largest cities in the United States with a city population of 2.8 million and a metro population approaching 10 million, Chicago is a huge, vibrant and friendly region that is well known for its live-music scene, comedy, shopping, dining, sports, architecture, highly regarded universities and colleges, and premier cultural attractions such as museums, zoos, aquarium, and planetariums. Take a trip to Chicago today!

CVG

Cincinnati

Come visit one of the United States’ first early boomtowns, including the Over-the-Rhine neighborhood, the largest National Historic District in the country. Have an inside look at this fast-growing metro area, and the home to a remarkable blend of industry and architecture. Downtown Cincinnati is surrounded by picturesque foothills that add a beautiful backdrop to the Queen City and its legendary skyline. You will not be disappointed by these views!

CMH

Columbus

Visit Columbus, Ohio, the capital of the state, and enjoy your free time exploring art and science museums, visiting the botanical gardens and even attending festivals of all kinds in the warmer months. There are so many local businesses to shop at, so many restaurants to satisfy your palate and so many sports events for you to enjoy!

DAL

Dallas

Experience big Texas culture and all it has to offer whether you are visiting the renowned State Fair right in the heart of Dallas, art, history or presidential museums, exciting entertainment districts such as Deep Ellum or the West End, and beautiful botanical gardens. Dallas also includes fantastic restaurants recognized for their premium steaks and honky-tonk barbeque. Nearby Fort Worth and Arlington also offer access to professional sports games and the famed Stockyards, where visitors can walk through a town reminiscent of the Old West. The “Dallas – Fort Worth Metroplex” offers an experience for every traveler with a variety of events taking place throughout the year.

DAB

Daytona Beach

Over 23 miles of public sand beaches and waterfront parks on Florida’s Atlantic coast await you, along with the boardwalk, thrilling rides and arcades. Home to the Daytona International Speedway where you can visit the Motorsports Hall of Fame and see the Daytona 500 and other NASCAR races.

DEN

Denver

Come visit Colorado’s capital, “The Mile-High City,” and enjoy the vibrant arts and performing art scene, the popular ski and snowboarding trails, the fun amusement parks and zoos, the unique and beautiful architecture, and a spectacular view of the Rocky Mountains. What more could you ask for?

DTW

Detroit

Detroit is the largest city in the state of Michigan, and is widely known for its Motown sound, rock music, world class museums, sports teams, arts, and even theaters. Detroit has had many of its historic buildings renovated, and its downtown core is now bustling with new developments and attractions. Detroit offers many things to see and do—an exciting travel destination filled with fun and history!

RSW

Fort Myers

This west Florida vacation spot may be quieter than its party neighbors on the eastern side of the state, but it’s definitely not less interesting! In Fort Myers, the hustle and bustle you find in other cities is replaced by family oriented beaches and historic homes. Nature is also important in this city; dozens of wildlife and nature preserves are scattered throughout the area, including Manatee Park. Since most of the coastline is preserved land, beachgoers congregate on the narrow Fort Myers Beach. Another big draw to Fort Myers: spring training!

FLL

Ft. Lauderdale

The reasons to visit Fort Lauderdale are infinite! There are 300+ sunshine-y days a year in this South Florida destination, giving visitors plenty of opportunities to enjoy nature, boating, diverse neighborhoods, events, and amazing attractions. Enjoy the breweries, beaches, downtown nightlife and the amazing culinary creations in Fort Lauderdale on your next visit!

GSP

Greenville-Spartanburg

Two great cities to explore resting amidst the beautifully scenic Blue Ridge mountains represent the best of South Carolina’s upstate region. Fishing; boating; horseback riding; hiking; this area has all of these and so much more to enjoy the outdoor landscape. Major local entertainment and sporting events attract visitors year-round whether it is for football in the fall, baseball in the spring and summer, or the Artisphere festival each May comprising many artists and musical talents.

JAX

Jacksonville

Jacksonville is the ideal Florida destination to explore the outdoors, enjoy some of the 22 miles of beaches, tasting delicious food and craft beer, and spending a day fishing! Explore Jacksonville today and experience the best that Florida has to offer.

LAX

Los Angeles

LA is the second largest metropolitan area in the country, and adventure is available around every corner. Come visit this iconic city—the place where movie stars, modern culture and busy streets are frequent and typical. This city is surrounded by film-worthy and beautiful beaches, as well as beautiful hiking trails and foliage for nature lovers. Visit LA today and enjoy a trip on the West Coast.

MSP

Minneapolis / St. Paul

MSP is not part of any city but is surrounded by Minneapolis, St. Paul and the suburban cities of Bloomington, Eagan, Mendota Heights and Richfield. This incredibly diverse and amazing metro area is known for theater, arts and culture, shopping and events. Foodies and outdoor enthusiasts will also find plenty to do outside and in the winter. MSP has the best of both worlds!

MYR

Myrtle Beach

Myrtle Beach is a popular tourist destination along the coast of South Carolina. The perfect location for your next trip, Myrtle Beach is widely known for its beautiful beaches, large selection of challenging golf courses, excellent seafood and southern style restaurants, and outlet-style shopping activities.

BNA

Nashville

Nashville is the hometown of country music and the birthplace of bluegrass, with roots in R&B, and a thriving pop and rock scene. With amazing music, vibes, and food, it is definitely the place for your next vacation!

LGA

New York, LaGuardia

New York City, also known as the Big Apple, is a city which offers infinite things to do, exquisite dining options and places to see. The city of skyscrapers has starred in films and novels that have made it a dream destination for so many people. Whether you plan to see a performance on Broadway, explore Central Park or visit the museums, New York City will surely be an amazing and fun filled experience.

EWR

Newark

The Garden State’s largest metropolis, Newark is the cultural center of the state, offering endless arts and entertainment options. The nation’s third oldest city, Newark is one of the leading historic spots in the Northeast, renowned as the most culturally affluent region in New Jersey. Newark has a lot to offer its visitors!

ORF

Norfolk

Norfolk has always been known as a Navy town, but it is also a major cultural center, with an upbeat and vibrant arts community. It hosts a growingly popular university, Old Dominion University (ODU), and world renowned hospitals and opera. In the last ten years, the downtown Norfolk area has experienced a major resurgence, with gourmet restaurants, shopping and attractions for all travelers to enjoy.

MCO

Orlando

When you’re ready to travel, Orlando may just be the best vacation ever! Enjoy fresh-air adventures at the Disney theme parks, unforgettable ecotourism experiences, and outdoor fun the whole family can enjoy all together—including al fresco dining and shopping! There are expansive resorts with incredible pools and recreational activities, and so many fun-in-the-sun hotspots!

PHL

Philadelphia

Famous as the birthplace of the USA and our origins of life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness, Philadelphia has an incredible variety of experiences waiting for you, no matter what time of year you visit. Cultural, culinary, artistic and multicultural treasures abound in this unforgettable city!

PIT

Pittsburgh

Pittsburgh, also known as the Steel City, is still grounded by its industrial roots. Filled with universities and pop culture, Pittsburgh is the place for your next visit! There are new and delicious restaurants opening all across the city, the museums are bursting with world-class art and regional history, Heinz Field hosts some of the best football games in the country, and there are plenty of outdoor activities along the city’s three rivers year-round.

PGD

Punta Gorda

The Charlotte Harbor Gulf Island Coast is a top destination for anyone looking for an outdoor Florida experience. Punta Gorda offers beaches, boating, fishing, and golfing. From nature discovery to shelling, collecting fossilized shark teeth and so much more, visitors can immerse themselves in the outdoor life of Punta Gorda and Englewood Beach and relax among the sun and trees.

RDU

Raleigh Durham

Explore this spectacular city in North Carolina, where you can enjoy acres of parkland that offer recreational activities year-round, a diverse art scene, one of the three major state museums, and a plethora of shopping and nightlife venues. There is so much to be discovered in Raleigh!

RIC

Richmond

Take in gorgeous antebellum architecture, enjoy wineries and festivals, and one of America’s most exhilarating theme parks all within close reach. This city also has a rich history taking visitors back to America’s founding moments with many museums showcasing Virginia’s key role in the country’s independence.

SAN

San Diego

Pristine coastal beaches, world-class dining, and immersive art museums make this dreamy Californian Navy town spectacular. Don’t forget to explore dozens of local golf courses, a world-renown zoo, and plenty of bucolic nature trails meant for hiking, camping, and exploration.

SJU

San Juan

Fly down to this vibrant Puerto Rican gateway offering expressions of local culture through food, music, and dancing. Throughout this beautiful and friendly island enclave visitors can journey across coastal and mountainous nature trails, enjoy birdwatching, or explore historic military forts taking you back in time. And of course, you can’t forget about the island’s many gorgeous soft and sandy beaches to sink your toes into.

SDQ

Santo Domingo

Explore this dynamic capital city where traditional charm meets contemporary Latin style. Discover 16th century neighborhoods, beautiful botanical gardens, and a salsa dance club in a huge underground cave!

SRQ

Sarasota

Sarasota, home to Siesta Key, the #1 beach in America is also known as Florida’s Cultural Coast. Enjoy concerts, museums, art galleries and even meetings with manatees. Come on down!

SAV

Savannah

Savannah is famous for its preservation of antebellum history and Southern charm. Visit this delightful town and be dazzled by its garden setting, the period architecture, and one-of-a-kind boutiques. Bright seafood right from the sea is a perfect complement to the city’s vibrant cocktail scene.

TPA

Tampa

Tampa is the place for families—and for animal lovers. And for conventioneers. But even if you don’t fit into any of those demographics, Tampa is for you, too! This balmy city by the bay still has plenty of charms away from the amusement park, the aquarium and the convention center. There’s lots of history here. And sports! And when you’ve exhausted all that Tampa has to offer, you can drive a few miles south to St. Petersburg for some sophisticated dining or to Clearwater for its gorgeous sugar-sand beach.

VRB

Vero Beach

Vero Beach is a small but elegant town along Florida’s Treasure Coast on the Atlantic side of the Sunshine State. It is known for its eclectic museums and art galleries, golf and fishing, and its peaceful and tranquil beaches. Vero Beach also offers a fine selection of oceanside shops, a historic downtown– and delectable cuisine for all budgets.

IAD

Washington Dulles

With its marbled monuments and high-profile politicos, Washington, D.C., is a great place to unwind and visit. And with a recent explosion of restaurants, cafes, boutiques and clubs, D.C. is transitioning into an amazing cultural hub. Of course, you can also explore classic attractions like the White House and the Washington Monument, the U.S. Capitol and the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History. Take a visit today!

DCA

Washington National

With its marbled monuments and high-profile politicos, Washington, D.C., is a great place to unwind and visit. With a recent explosion of restaurants, cafes, boutiques and clubs, D.C. is transitioning into an amazing cultural hub. Of course, you can also explore classic attractions like the White House, the Washington Monument, the U.S. Capitol, and the Smithsonian National Museum of Natural History. Take a visit today!

PBI

West Palm Beach

Come visit the amazing city of West Palm Beach in Florida. Located just over an hour from Miami, you can enjoy the amazing beaches and sun-filled sky while eating mouthwatering cuisine. Visit downtown West Palm Beach and see all of the shops and restaurants on Clematis Street, or head down to City Place for even more shopping, drinks, and nightlife! West Palm has it all.
